result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 86 days credit for time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.
- Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022.

miscConds.notes: - The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) be paid through collection by June 9, 2023 or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.  Any remaining balance to be applied to costs and surchages in 21CF1650 or 21CM986.

- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- Possess no weapons/firearms.

- Mental Health Unit Monitoring and comply with conditions. 
- Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention or Anger Management which may be determined by the Department.
- Take all prescribed medication.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Comply with any schooling determined appropriate by the department.
- Cooperate with agent and Chapter 51.
- Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson

records.addlTxt: Case calendared for Probation Review Hearing September 23, 2022 at 8:30 am.  Court notified Defendant is in absconder status and a warrant has been issued.  Probation Review Hearing removed from Court's calendar this date.  bm
Probation Review Memo received and filed.  Defendant in absconder status.  bm
COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.fp

records.addlTxt:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as amended and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

  Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 86 days credit for time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:
Court imposed and stayed 10 days condition time to be used at the Court's discretion. Concurrent.
Mental Health Unit Monitoring and comply with conditions. 
Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention or Anger Management which may be determined by the Department.
Take all prescribed medication.
Absolute sobriety
No illegal drugs or alcohol.
Comply with any schooling determined appropriate by the department.
Cooperate with agent and Chapter 51.
The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) be paid through collection by June 9, 2023 or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.  Any remaining balance to be applied to costs and surchages in 21CF1650 or 21CM986.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Possess no weapons/firearms.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Pursuant to negotations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor to which Defense entered a temporary plea of not guilty.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Parties have reached a resolution.  Parties agree via email to Projected Guilty Plea date of June 9, 2022 at 8:30 am.  bm
Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea received and filed.  bm
Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm
Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea received and filed.  bm

Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Jury first call.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Court proceeding to trial on another matter.  Case passed to June 7, 2022 at 8:30 am for possible plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Exclude Evidence at Trial received and filed.  bm
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm

Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Status Conference.  State and Defense prepared for Jury Trial.  No Formal Offer to Defense.  Defense could bring Motion to defendant's 23 hour lockdown.  Case remains on calendar for Jury Trial scheduled July 6, 2022, at 8:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Gace C., Mercy C., Shalom C., and Christopher C.

Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  nk
  Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Court modified Just Point monitoring to Level 5.  Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant to comply with his CARS team.  State to submit order.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand.  Expires 7/5/22

Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  State orally moves for joinder with Defendant's other cases pending before the Court.  Case Nos. 21CF001650 & 21CM986.  Defense objects.  State requests a bail hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF1650. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Ramirez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Grace C.; Mercy C.; Shalom C.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shamar Gedarous Rashad Anderson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/ live/ 4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
